item.title: Mobile bike repair unit, 2nd August
item.description:
It would appear that an informal mobile motorcycle repair unit is in operation 7 days a week beside the bridge, unfortunately outside the allotment gardens. Noise pollution very unpleasant for locals residents.

item.title: Building works next to British Museum on Montague St, 2nd August
item.description:
1x yellow ramp has become detached from its bolt(s), which was holding it in place. It is a high-traffic area and the ramp had slipped off when I passed through this morning. Please could it be re-attached ? It is less important now that the pole (which was blocking the footway) has been removed, but it is possibly still necessary for wheelchair/disabled users. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montague Street, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass, beer bottles littered and lots of litter all along both sides of Chesham Avenue, 2nd August
item.description:
Hi It has been here a little while now and I didn’t report it initially as there was already a report logged and then it said it had been resolved. I think there must be an error in the system as this is definitely not resolved. Lots of children and dog walkers come down Chesham Avenue and this is not an isolated incident, at times the pavement is not passable and you have to venture into the road to avoid broken glass. Not the council’s fault that people think it’s ok to do this obviously but please do check this area regularly as it will continue to be an issue sadly. Many thanks in advance

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chesham Avenue, Petts Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Report 7955964 unsatisfactory, 2nd August
item.description:
I reported graffiti on the Propella statue information board outside Crayford Library. It is said to be resolved, but there is no protective layer on the board & it has already got scribble over the writing & is peeling at the bottom left corner, so is vulnerable to rain damage. I do not think the report is adequately resolved.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crayford Road, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dulwich, London

item.title: Gas canisters dumped on footpath, 2nd August
item.description:
There are several boxes containing used gas canisters on the footpath at the end of Broad Lawn close to where it joins Green Lane. There's also a large plastic container with a tube coming out if it. We think teenagers are congregating there, taking laughing gas and dumping the remains. The other day there was Vodka and various other things left. It needs removing and perhaps warning signs put in place this isn't acceptable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Broad Lawn, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Planter in corner of communal square littered with cat and fox excrement and dead weeds, 2nd August
item.description:
Planter in the Corner of the square next to 41 Langdale close is covered in overgrown dead weeds and is covered with fox and cat excrement. which can be smelt when walking past it on an almost daily basis. The larger planter in the middle of the square was recently maintained but this planter and whole area around the planter has been neglected.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Langdale Close, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet
